summary: Calculate genotype posterior probabilities given family and/or known population genotypes

arguments.summary: If true, adds a PG tag to created SAM/BAM/CRAM files.
arguments.name: --add-output-sam-program-record

arguments.summary: If true, adds a command line header line to created VCF files.
arguments.name: --add-output-vcf-command-line

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable). Defaults to cloudPrefetchBuffer if unset.
arguments.name: --cloud-index-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: Size of the cloud-only prefetch buffer (in MB; 0 to disable).
arguments.name: --cloud-prefetch-buffer

arguments.summary: If true, create a BAM/CRAM index when writing a coordinate-sorted BAM/CRAM file.
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a MD5 digest for any BAM/SAM/CRAM file created
arguments.name: --create-output-bam-md5

arguments.summary: If true, create a VCF index when writing a coordinate-sorted VCF file.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-index

arguments.summary: If true, create a a MD5 digest any VCF file created.
arguments.name: --create-output-variant-md5

arguments.summary: Prior for de novo mutations
arguments.name: --de-novo-prior
arguments.fulltext:
The de novo mutation prior -- i.e. the probability that a new mutation occurs. Sensitivity analysis on known de novo
 mutations suggests a default value of 10^-6.

arguments.summary: Use AC rather than MLEAC
arguments.name: --default-to-allele-count
arguments.fulltext:
By default the tool looks for MLEAC first, and then falls back to AC if MLEAC is not found. When this
 flag is set, the behavior is flipped and the tool looks first for the AC field and then fall back to MLEAC or
 raw genotypes.

arguments.summary: If true, don't cache bam indexes, this will reduce memory requirements but may harm performance if many intervals are specified.  Caching is automatically disabled if there are no intervals specified.
arguments.name: --disable-bam-index-caching

arguments.summary: Read filters to be disabled before analysis
arguments.name: --disable-read-filter

arguments.summary: If specified, do not check the sequence dictionaries from our inputs for compatibility. Use at your own risk!
arguments.name: --disable-sequence-dictionary-validation

arguments.summary: Disable all tool default read filters (WARNING: many tools will not function correctly without their default read filters on)
arguments.name: --disable-tool-default-read-filters

arguments.summary: Do not use discovered allele count in the input callset for variants that do not appear in the external callset.
arguments.name: --discovered-allele-count-priors-off
arguments.fulltext:
Don't add input sample ACs for variants not seen in the supporting panel.  Default is to add discovered AC from input samples
 provided there are at least 10 input samples or if num-ref-samples-if-no-call is greater than zero.

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals to exclude from processing
arguments.name: --exclude-intervals
arguments.fulltext:
Use this argument to exclude certain parts of the genome from the analysis (like -L, but the opposite).
 This argument can be specified multiple times. You can use samtools-style intervals either explicitly on the
 command line (e.g. -XL 1 or -XL 1:100-200) or by loading in a file containing a list of intervals
 (e.g. -XL myFile.intervals).

arguments.summary: A configuration file to use with the GATK.
arguments.name: --gatk-config-file

arguments.summary: If the GCS bucket channel errors out, how many times it will attempt to re-initiate the connection
arguments.name: --gcs-max-retries

arguments.summary: Project to bill when accessing "requester pays" buckets. If unset, these buckets cannot be accessed.  User must have storage.buckets.get permission on the bucket being accessed.
arguments.name: --gcs-project-for-requester-pays

arguments.summary: Global Dirichlet prior parameters for the indel allele frequency
arguments.name: --global-prior-indel
arguments.fulltext:
Prior indel pseudocounts for Dirichlet distribution of allele frequencies. The posterior distribution is a
 Dirichlet with parameters given by pseudocounts plus the number of occurrences in the resource vcfs.

arguments.summary: Global Dirichlet prior parameters for the SNP allele frequency
arguments.name: --global-prior-snp
arguments.fulltext:
Prior SNP pseudocounts for Dirichlet distribution of allele frequencies. The posterior distribution is a
 Dirichlet with parameters given by pseudocounts plus the number of occurrences in the resource vcfs.

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Use external information only
arguments.name: --ignore-input-samples
arguments.fulltext:
When this flag is set, only the AC and AN calculated from external sources will be used, and the calculation
 will not use the discovered allele frequency in the callset whose posteriors are being calculated. Useful for
 callsets containing related individuals.

arguments.summary: BAM/SAM/CRAM file containing reads
arguments.name: --input

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are excluding.
arguments.name: --interval-exclusion-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -XL. For example, '-XL 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-XL 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Interval merging rule for abutting intervals
arguments.name: --interval-merging-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program merges abutting intervals (i.e. intervals that are directly side-by-side but do not
 actually overlap) into a single continuous interval. However you can change this behavior if you want them to be
 treated as separate intervals instead.

arguments.summary: Amount of padding (in bp) to add to each interval you are including.
arguments.name: --interval-padding
arguments.fulltext:
Use this to add padding to the intervals specified using -L. For example, '-L 1:100' with a
 padding value of 20 would turn into '-L 1:80-120'. This is typically used to add padding around targets when
 analyzing exomes.

arguments.summary: Set merging approach to use for combining interval inputs
arguments.name: --interval-set-rule
arguments.fulltext:
By default, the program will take the UNION of all intervals specified using -L and/or -XL. However, you can
 change this setting for -L, for example if you want to take the INTERSECTION of the sets instead. E.g. to
 perform the analysis only on chromosome 1 exomes, you could specify -L exomes.intervals -L 1 --interval-set-rule
 INTERSECTION. However, it is not possible to modify the merging approach for intervals passed using -XL (they will
 always be merged using UNION).

 Note that if you specify both -L and -XL, the -XL interval set will be subtracted from the -L interval set.

options.summary: Take the union of all intervals
options.name: UNION

options.summary: Take the intersection of intervals (the subset that overlaps all intervals specified)
options.name: INTERSECTION

arguments.summary: One or more genomic intervals over which to operate
arguments.name: --intervals

arguments.summary: Lenient processing of VCF files
arguments.name: --lenient

arguments.summary: If non-zero, partitions VCF output into shards, each containing up to the given number of records.
arguments.name: --max-variants-per-shard

arguments.summary: Number of hom-ref genotypes to infer at sites not present in a panel
arguments.name: --num-reference-samples-if-no-call
arguments.fulltext:
When a variant is not seen in a panel, this argument controls whether to infer (and with what effective strength)
 that only reference alleles were observed at that site. E.g. "If not seen in 1000Genomes, treat it as AC=0,
 AN=2000", where AN=2*nSamples for human autosomes.

arguments.summary: File to which variants should be written
arguments.name: --output

arguments.summary: Pedigree file for samples
arguments.name: --pedigree
arguments.fulltext:
See https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/article.php?id=7696 for more details on the PED
 format. Note that each -ped argument can be tagged with NO_FAMILY_ID, NO_PARENTS, NO_SEX, NO_PHENOTYPE to
 tell the GATK PED parser that the corresponding fields are missing from the ped file.

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Read filters to be applied before analysis
arguments.name: --read-filter

arguments.summary: Indices to use for the read inputs. If specified, an index must be provided for every read input and in the same order as the read inputs. If this argument is not specified, the path to the index for each input will be inferred automatically.
arguments.name: --read-index

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM/BAM/CRAM/SRA files read by this program.  The default stringency value SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --read-validation-stringency

arguments.summary: Reference sequence
arguments.name: --reference

arguments.summary: Output traversal statistics every time this many seconds elapse
arguments.name: --seconds-between-progress-updates

arguments.summary: Use the given sequence dictionary as the master/canonical sequence dictionary.  Must be a .dict file.
arguments.name: --sequence-dictionary

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: If true, don't emit genotype fields when writing vcf file output.
arguments.name: --sites-only-vcf-output

arguments.summary: Skip application of family-based priors
arguments.name: --skip-family-priors
arguments.fulltext: Skip application of family-based priors. Note: if pedigree file is absent, family-based priors will always be skipped.

arguments.summary: Skip application of population-based priors
arguments.name: --skip-population-priors

arguments.summary: Other callsets to use in generating genotype posteriors
arguments.name: --supporting-callsets
arguments.fulltext:
Supporting external panels. Allele counts from these panels (taken from AC,AN or MLEAC,AN or raw genotypes) will
 be used to inform the frequency distribution underlying the genotype priors. These files must be VCF 4.2 spec or later.

arguments.summary: Temp directory to use.
arguments.name: --tmp-dir

arguments.summary: Use flat priors for indels
arguments.name: --use-flat-priors-for-indels
arguments.fulltext:
Use flat priors for indels (can be used to replicate the legacy CalculateGenotypePosteriors behavior)
 If an input variant contains an indel allele, flat priors will be applied to that site. If a reference panel
 variant contains an indel allele, flat priors will be applied instead.

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkDeflater (as opposed to IntelDeflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-deflater

arguments.summary: Whether to use the JdkInflater (as opposed to IntelInflater)
arguments.name: --use-jdk-inflater

arguments.summary: A VCF file containing variants
arguments.name: --variant

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --verbosity

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description:
Calculate genotype posterior probabilities given family and/or known population genotypes

The tool calculates the posterior genotype probability for each sample genotype in a given VCF format callset. The input variants must present genotype likelihoods generated by HaplotypeCaller, UnifiedGenotyper or other source that provides unbiased genotype likelihoods.

The tool can use priors from three different data sources: (i) one or more supporting germline population callsets with specific annotation(s) if supplied , (ii) the pedigree for a trio if supplied and if the trio is represented in the callset under refinement, and/or (iii) the allele counts of the callset samples themselves given at least ten samples. It is possible to deactivate the contribution of the callset samples with the --ignore-input-samples flag.

For more background information and for mathematical details, see GATK forum article at https://software.broadinstitute.org/gatk/documentation/article?id=11074. Additional GATK mathematical notes are presented as whitepapers in the gatk GitHub repository docs section at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk/tree/master/docs.

Inputs

  • A VCF with genotype likelihoods, and optionally genotypes, AC/AN fields, or MLEAC/AN fields. The tool will use MLEAC if available or AC if MLEAC is not provided. AN is also required unless genotypes are provided for all samples.
  • (Optional) A PED pedigree file containing the description of the relationships between individuals. The tool considers only trio groups. A trio consists of mother-father-child.

Optionally, a collection of VCFs can be provided for the purpose of informing population allele frequency priors. Each of these resource VCFs must satisfy at least one of the following requirement sets:

  • AC field and AN field
  • MLEAC field and AN field
  • Genotypes

Output

A new VCF with the following information:

  • Genotype posteriors added to the FORMAT fields ("PP")
  • Genotypes and GQ assigned according to these posteriors (note that the original genotype and GQ may change)
  • Per-site genotype priors added to the INFO field ("PG")
  • (Optional) Per-site, per-trio joint likelihoods (JL) and joint posteriors (JP) given as Phred-scaled probability of all genotypes in the trio being correct based on the PLs for JL and the PPs for JP. These annotations are added to the FORMAT fields.

Notes

By default, priors will be applied to each variant separately, provided each variant features data from at least 10 called samples (no-calls do not count). SNP sites in the input callset that have a SNP at the matching site in the supporting VCF will have priors applied based on the AC from the supporting samples and the input callset unless the --ignore-input-samples flag is used. If a site is not called in the supporting VCF, priors will be applied using the discovered AC from the input samples unless the --discovered-allele-count-priors-off flag is used. For any non-SNP sites in the input callset, flat priors are applied.

For versions of the tool 4.0.5.0+, the tool appropriately applies priors to indels.

If applying family priors, only diploid family genotypes are supported. In addition, family priors only apply to trios represented in both a supplied pedigree and in the callset under refinement. Note, if the pedigree is incomplete, the tools skips calculating family priors. In this case, and in the absence of other refinement, the results will be identical to the input.

Usage examples

Refine genotypes based on the discovered allele frequency in an input VCF containing many samples

 gatk --java-options "-Xmx4g" CalculateGenotypePosteriors \
   -V multisample_input.vcf.gz \
   -O output.vcf.gz

Inform the genotype assignment of a single sample using the 1000G phase 3 samples

 gatk --java-options "-Xmx4g" CalculateGenotypePosteriors \
   -V sample_input.vcf.gz \
   -O sample_output.1000G_PPs.vcf.gz \
   -supporting 1000G.phase3.integrated.sites_only.no_MATCHED_REV.hg38.vcf.gz

Apply only family priors to a callset

 gatk --java-options "-Xmx4g" CalculateGenotypePosteriors \
   -V input.vcf.gz \
   -O output.vcf.gz \
   -ped family.ped \
   --skip-population-priors

Apply frequency and HWE-based priors to the genotypes of a family without including the family allele counts in the allele frequency estimates

 gatk --java-options "-Xmx4g" CalculateGenotypePosteriors \
   -V input.vcf.gz \
   -O output.vcf.gz \
   --ignore-input-samples

Calculate the posterior genotypes of a callset, and impose that a variant *not seen* in the external panel is tantamount to being AC=0, AN=5008 within that panel

 gatk --java-options "-Xmx4g" CalculateGenotypePosteriors \
   -V input.vcf.gz \
   -O output.vcf.gz \
   -supporting 1000G.phase3.integrated.sites_only.no_MATCHED_REV.hg38.vcf.gz \
   --num-reference-samples-if-no-call 2504

Caveat

If applying family priors, only diploid family genotypes are supported
name: CalculateGenotypePosteriors
